items.title: Leslie Lilley said he would ‘slaughter migrants’
items.summary: Leslie Lilley, not content with being outed for his links to Gary Raikes, has also made worrying statements on Facebook about refugees. The Southend East…
items.content_html:
Leslie Lilley, not content with being outed for his links to Gary Raikes, has also made worrying statements on Facebook about refugees. The Southend East & Rochford candidate made the comments on his official Facebook campaign account.

In June 2020, Lilley responded to news of a small boat arriving in Dover by posting: “I hope I’m near one of these scumbags one day I won’t run away I’ll slaughter them then have their family taken out.” He also suggested Border Force vessels should have razor wire to tear small boats carrying migrants across the Channel.

Lilley has also argued that the pandemic was a plan to “depopulate the world” and was “mass murder by government”.

Source:
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/politics/article/reform-candidate-leslie-lilley-said-he-would-slaughter-migrants-d7rl2dgt6 [https://archive.ph/RvPx4]

items.title: Grant StClair-Armstrong steps down over BNP links
items.summary: The Times reports that Grant StClair-Armstrong has stepped down as Reform candidate for North West Essex. In comments unearthed from a 2010 blog, StClair-Armstrong encouraged…
items.content_html:
The Times reports that Grant StClair-Armstrong has stepped down as Reform candidate for North West Essex.

In comments unearthed from a 2010 blog, StClair-Armstrong encouraged voters to vote for the British National Party. He wrote “I could weep now, every time I pick up a British newspaper and read the latest about the state of the UK. No doubt, Enoch Powell would be doing the same if he was alive. My solution … vote BNP!”

The comments were found on an archived version of the website, which has since been changed.

When approached by The Times about the comments, StClair-Armstrong said: “I don’t have this stuff on my website any more. … I removed all that stuff and made the website respectable. … I cleaned up my act a long long time ago. I’m sure if you look around you’ll find some really nice posts, how I feel about animals, animal welfare, how I feel about the planet. It’s not all bad.”

Regarding the Enoch Powel and BNP comments, he said “I’ve got no excuses for that. I think they’re a disgusting party. I don’t like the English Defence League. I don’t like them.” He added that he saw no alternative but to stand down as a Reform candidate.

Sources:
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/politics/article/reform-uk-candidate-resign-bnp-support-q33rphtzt [https://archive.ph/rb07v]
https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2024/06/17/reform-candidate-resigns-bnp-historic-comments/ [https://archive.ph/OGVkB]

items.title: Gary Raikes' Facebook Friends
items.summary: The Times reports that at least 41 people standing for Reform are connected to Gary Raikes on Facebook. Raikes, a former organiser for the British…
items.content_html:
The Times reports that at least 41 people standing for Reform are connected to Gary Raikes on Facebook.

Raikes, a former organiser for the British National Party, founded the New British Union in the image of Oswald Mosley’s British Union of Fascists, with activists who call themselves “blackshirts”. The New British Union has called for a “fascist revolution” and sees parliamentary democracy as an “obstruction” to be replaced with a dictatorship.

Of the 41 Reform candidates linked to Raikes as Facebook Friends, The Times named the following:

Name Constituency
Steve Beatty Didcot and Wantage
Leslie Lilley Southend East and Rochford
Grant Randall Rayleigh and Wickford

Leslie Lilley, candidate for Southend East & Rochford is also reported as posting messages suggesting that “the Illuminati” control the world and that the Covid-19 vaccine rollout was a “crime against humanity”.

Source:
https://www.thetimes.com/article/10c14799-7f79-4cc1-b845-c4c89b5efd58?shareToken=75aa3040b33773175e187890aa299242 [https://archive.ph/vMwyM]

items.title: Ian Gribbin's remarks on Hitler
items.summary: Bexhill and Battle Constituency Ian Gribbin, candidate in Bexhill and Battle, has apologised for posts he made on the Unherd website, including the claim that…
items.content_html:
Bexhill and Battle Constituency

Ian Gribbin, candidate in Bexhill and Battle, has apologised for posts he made on the Unherd website, including the claim that Britain would be “in a far better state today” if it had “taken Hitler up on his offer of neutrality” instead of fighting the Nazis in World War Two.

Gribbin also wrote that women were the “sponging gender” and should be “deprived of health care”.

Men pay 80% of tax – women spend 80% of tax revenue. On aggregate as a group you only take from society.

Just to cap things off, Gribbin also said Winston Churchill was “abysmal” and praised Russian President Vladimir Putin.

The Reform Party’s initial response to criticisms of the remarks was to defend them, including telling the Jewish Chronicle, “We’re not going to sack him, he’s done nothing wrong.”

After initially declining to comment, Gribbin did later apologise:

I apologise for these old comments and withdraw them unreservedly and the upset that they have caused.”

Commenting on his candidate’s remarks, Nigel Farage claimed vetting issues caused by the unexpected election timing.

Sources:
https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cjmmrwexv4ko
https://www.theguardian.com/politics/article/2024/jun/10/reform-uk-defends-candidate-over-hitler-neutrality-comments
https://www.thejc.com/news/politics/reform-uk-candidate-says-britain-should-have-stayed-neutral-in-ww2-rc2yrizd

items.title: Times round-up of problematic candidates
items.summary: The Times has published a round-up of several problematic candidates, shortly after the deadline for General Election selection passed. Of the Reform candidates, The Times…
items.content_html:
The Times has published a round-up of several problematic candidates, shortly after the deadline for General Election selection passed. Of the Reform candidates, The Times reported this:

Name Constituency Remarks
Robert Lomas Barnsley North Claimed asylum seekers had it “in their DNA to lie” and that “black people of Britain” were “grifting the race card”
Marc Burca Kensington and Bayswater Defended Ghislaine Maxwell, saying her sentence was “very harsh and vindictive” as “she seemingly facilitated a few 16-17-year-old prostitutes”
Hugo Miller Horsham Called black Americans “negroes” and said they should feel “gratitude” for being allowed to integrate into American society
Andrea Whitehead Leeds West and Pudsey Liked a Facebook post labelling Sadiq Khan an “undercover Jihadist”
Craig Birtwistle Worsley and Eccles Liked a post calling for a complete ban on Islam, which added: “Let them leave if they don’t like it.”
Ken Ferguson Wirral West Liked an anti-vax message on social media, an Islamophobic tweet joking that Muslim men married 12-year-olds and a post denying human-induced climate change
Garry Sutherland Exmouth and Exeter East Found guilty and fined £2,000 for kicking a dog in August 2023
Stewart Sutherland Blaenau Gwent and Rhymney Promoted a tweet by leader of Britain First that claimed Sunak and Khan’s political success was evidence of the “Great Replacement”, a racist conspiracy theory
Lucian Fernando Hastings and Rye Fined and disqualified from driving in 2021 for being drunk in charge of a car, and six months later was caught driving whilst disqualified and also had a charge upheld for failing to provide a blood sample. “I made a mistake and I learnt from it.”

Source:
https://www.thetimes.com/uk/politics/article/reform-uk-party-candidates-election-drug-smuggler-ghislaine-maxwell-r5pmh7q5d [https://archive.is/lTfN4]

items.title: Lee Anderson wants refugees sent to the Outer Hebrides
items.summary: Ashfield Constituency Ex-Labour, ex-Conservative Reform candidate for Ashfield has a solution for dealing with asylum seekers that doesn’t involve sending them to Rwanda. According to…
items.content_html:
Ashfield Constituency

Ex-Labour, ex-Conservative Reform candidate for Ashfield has a solution for dealing with asylum seekers that doesn’t involve sending them to Rwanda. According to Lee Anderson, speaking to Jo Coburn on the BBC’s Politics Live,

… there is another solution to the illegal migrants, and this is going to probably get me into some sort of hot water with you lot in the media.
I said this to a previous home secretary, I won’t say which one, but if some of these migrants do land on the beaches, let’s take them to a remote Scottish island somewhere, the Outer Hebrides where nobody lives, give them the building material and let them set their own camps up.
I’m sure they’ll be safe and free from persecution in war-torn France.”

Sources:
https://www.thenational.scot/news/24350740.lee-anderson-send-refugees-outer-hebrides-nobody-lives/
https://www.express.co.uk/news/politics/1904520/Lee-Anderson-migrants-scottish-highlands
